name_of_ordered_mutable_list.comment: Provided by `java.util.LinkedList` (doubly linked list) or `java.util.ArrayList` (array backed doubly linked list).
name_of_ordered_mutable_list.name: What is a ordered mutable list called?

create_a_ordered_mutable_list.comment: Most built-in collection types in Java support generics.
create_a_ordered_mutable_list.name: Create the list

ordered_mutable_list_start_number.name: What number does it start at?

ordered_mutable_list_can_be_inserted_in_.name: Can you insert into the middle of it?

access_element_in_ordered_mutable_list.comment: This will be constant time in an `ArrayList`, but potentially slow in a `LinkedList`.
access_element_in_ordered_mutable_list.name: Access element by index

insert_into_beginning_of_ordered_mutable.name: Insert element at beginning

insert_into_end_of_ordered_mutable_list.name: Insert element at end

insert_into_middle_of_ordered_mutable_li.comment: This will be slow in a `LinkedList`, but fast in an `ArrayList`.
insert_into_middle_of_ordered_mutable_li.name: Insert element in middle

erase_element_at_beginning_of_ordered_mu.name: Erase first element

erase_element_at_end_of_ordered_mutable_.name: Erase last element

erase_element_in_middle_of_ordered_mutab.comment: This will be slow in a `LinkedList`, but fast in an `ArrayList`.
erase_element_in_middle_of_ordered_mutab.name: Erase element in the middle

delete_ordered_mutable_list.comment: If this was the last reference to the list Object, it is now eligible for garbage collection.
delete_ordered_mutable_list.name: Delete the list

name_of_unordered_mutable_list.name: What is a unordered mutable list called?

unordered_mutable_list_start_number.name: What number does it start at?

unordered_mutable_list_can_be_inserted_i.name: Can you insert into the middle of it?

name_of_ordered_immutable_list.comment: Can only be created via a factory method.
name_of_ordered_immutable_list.name: What is a ordered immutable list called?

ordered_immutable_list_start_number.name: What number does it start at?

name_of_unordered_immutable_list.name: What is a unordered immutable list called?

unordered_immutable_list_start_number.name: What number does it start at?

name_of_mutable_hashed_list.comment: The `java.util.LinkedHashSet` provides set semantics, but preserves entries in the order they were added.
name_of_mutable_hashed_list.name: What is a mutable hashed list called?

erase_element_from_mutable_hashed_list.name: Erase an element from the list

delete_mutable_hashed_list.comment: If this was the last reference to the list Object, it is now eligible for garbage collection.
delete_mutable_hashed_list.name: Delete the list

name_of_immutable_hashed_list.name: What is an immutable hashed list called?

erase_element_from_immutable_hashed_list.name: Erase an element from the list

delete_mutable_set.comment: If this was the last reference to the list Object, it is now eligible for garbage collection.
delete_mutable_set.name: Delete the set

create_a_immutable_set.comment: Can only be created via a factory method.
create_a_immutable_set.name: Create an immutable key/value set

delete_immutable_set.comment: If this was the last reference to the list Object, it is now eligible for garbage collection.
delete_immutable_set.name: Delete the set

find_element_by_value.comment: The stream capabilities added in Java 8+ provide a generic map, filter, and reduce capability for all built-in collections.
find_element_by_value.name: Find/search for an element by value

find_minimum_element.name: Find the minimum value in a list

find_maximum_element.name: Find the maximum value in a list

convert_list_to_string.comment: If the list contains non-String objects, you can use the stream capabilities to map the items to Strings first.
convert_list_to_string.name: Convert a list to a string

split_list_at_index.code:
List<Integer> firstPart = myList.subList(0,1);
List<Integer> secondPart = myList.subList(1, myList.size());
split_list_at_index.name: Split lists at an index

duplicate_subset_of_list.name: Duplicate a portion/subset of a list

resize_list.code: You can remove items individually to reach the desired size.
resize_list.name: Increase/decrease list size

do_two_lists_match_exactly.comment: Check the Javadocs for the type of list1 to confirm the behavior is deep equals.
do_two_lists_match_exactly.name: Do two lists match every element?

do_two_lists_contain_same_items.comment: Check the Javadocs for the type of list1 to confirm the behavior is deep equals.
do_two_lists_contain_same_items.name: Do two lists contain all the same items?

does_list_satisfy_some_expression.name: Does a list satisfy some expression?

does_list_not_satisfy_an_expression.name: Does a list entirely not satisfy an expression?

sort_list.comment: `Collections.sort` has an overloaded version that takes a comparator as the second parameter, if custom comparison logic is needed.
sort_list.name: Sort a list

filter.comment: Find all elements greater than 10, return as a new list.
filter.name: Filter a list based on criteria

reduce_left.code:
List<Integer> ages = Arrays.asList(25, 30, 45, 28, 32);
int computedAges = ages.parallelStream().reduce(0, (a, b) -> a + b, Integer::sum);
reduce_left.name: Reduce a list left-to-right
